text.sentence: We update our airline estimates for the recent declines in oil prices.
We now assume dollar thirty five/bbl WTI for two thousand sixteen, roughly dollar eightbn in added fuel savings for US airlines on top of the ~ dollar eighteenbn in two thousand fifteen savings.
We've assumed that ~forty percent of the savings will convert to profits, lower than the ~sixty percent we saw convert to profit in two thousand fifteen.
All told, we now expect the US industry to produce nearly dollar thirtybn in pre tax profits and generate ~ dollar sixteenbn in free cash.
Fundamentally so long as we avoid full recession US airlines are likely to see yet another historic year of profitability in two thousand sixteen.

Adding further caution to our revenue assumptions: Lower oil is likely to pressure unit revenue for yet another year, and we now assume a similar domestic RASM decline in two thousand sixteen as two thousand fifteen .
We expect international unit revenue to decline somewhat less in two thousand sixteen than two thousand fifteen given diminishing FX pressure .
For oneQ, we expect a system RASM decline that is similar to fourQ, with that same pace of decline carried through two thousand sixteen.
Given the lag between fuel moves and revenue our work says about four months we'd expect further incremental drag in twoQ.
Sequentially, the slowing in revenue we expect is broadly similar to what we saw in oneH two thousand fifteen as low oil worked into demand/pricing.
percent domestic capacity growth, but that very well could tick higher: Initial capacity guide and current schedules point to some moderation in domestic capacity growth.
Lower oil may well add to growth, something we'd see more likely in domestic than international.
We expect ~two percent international capacity growth in two thousand sixteen from US airlines, well below the pace for non US carriers.
Our Top Pick remains UAL, where we think heightened macro concerns are more than offset by self help opportunity .
Legacy airlines are trading at EV/sales multiples that are comparable to late one thousand nine hundred ninetys, which we view as an indication that the industry is still misunderstood by the market.
It doesn't help that value and cyclicals are currently out of favor, which we think is a perfect description of US airlines.
Unchanged For a full list of our ratings, price target and earnings changes in this report, please see table on page two.
Barclays Capital Inc. and/or one of its affiliates does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports.

With oil now in the dollar thirty/bbl range, we expect another record year for airlines in two thousand sixteen, combined with another year of declining RASM.
Despite putting less fuel benefit through to earnings than last year, our numbers remain above the Street.
While we are above the Street in estimates, we remain below the Street on revenue.
Our revised estimates are below current Street revenue estimates by over two points.
percent Difference fifteen percent ten percent five percent percent five percent ten percent Revenue EBIT EPS two.three percent eight.

However, as the Hawaii opportunity is largely realized, we think incremental growth in traditional markets becomes dilutive and will likely limit ALK's relative margin expansion.
Our upside scenario assumes fuel stays low through two thousand sixteen with much more limited revenue offset.
Our downside scenario assumes that the two thousand sixteen base EPS misses by fifteen percent on competitive pressures and the P/E multiple becomes eleven.onex.

In our view, LUV has transitioned from a margin `catch up' story in two thousand twelve two thousand fourteen to a now average `big four' airline trading at too large a premium.
We see plenty of strengths in LUV's cost structure and network that drives a very dominant position in shorthaul business.
Yet, markets like Atlanta, New York and Philadelphia highlight the limits of LUV's model.
Our upside scenario assumes fuel stays low through two thousand sixteen with much more limited revenue offset.

Our downside scenario assumes that the two thousand sixteen base EPS misses by seven percent and the current multiple becomes six.sixx.

U.S. Airlines Alaska Air Group Valuation Methodology: Our PT of dollar ninety is driven by a two thousand sixteenE P/E multiple of eleven.fivex
Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: Investing in ALK is risky.

Our outlook is predicated on historical trading patterns and our current profit expectations, which hinge on our view that the supply and demand balance in the industry will improve substantially in the years to come allowing ALK to raise prices significantly.

If we have cause to question any of our assumptions about demand recovery, industry capacity decisions, various competitive forces, labor issues or geopolitical events among other things, we might be forced to make substantial and frequent changes to our profit expectations, targets, and recommendations.

Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.

Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price nineteen January two thousand sixteen fifteen Air Lease Corp. Allegiant Travel Co. JetBlue Airways United Continental Holdings Aircastle Ltd.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
